I was so looking forward to my visit here. It had been a long time since I had been here and was anticipating a long wait. When we showed up during prime dinner time and there were 3 tables with people at them, we should have known better.  Waiting tables 101: Keep the customer happy. I don't think I'm unreasonable. I made one request throughout the entire dinner. Please bring out salad, then our pizza. We don't like to eat cold pizza anytime, especially when it's a $15 pizza. Out they came together, no apology, no recognition.  Service went downhill from there. We asked for bread to go with our salad. That was brought at the end of our meal. I always love a "dessert" of cold, hard sourdough bread to end my meal.  The most irritating part of the whole evening was the prices. Since I had been there in the past, I knew pretty much what to anticipate. But the portions have gotten much smaller and the prices have gotten MUCH bigger. $30+ for salad and pizza? It better be wonderful, and the waiter better fall all over himself to treat us well. Neither happened.  I would rather go pretty much anywhere else, and won't be back here. Ever.

I am amazed at the negative reviews for CPK!  I have loved this place since the first time I went & I have been plenty of times!  I got on Yelp tonight to post our positive Veterans Day experience, but after reading some of the reviews, I would like to say,  The food & service is always excellent at this location.  My husband eats salmon at least once a week and this is at the top of the list of places to eat it.  My favorite pizza anywhere is the California Club (thin crust) and I love the hummus, the chopped salad and the delicious butter cake!  I cannot list more, because I keep eating the same things; they are too good to pass up!  Now my Veterans Day comments: Just wanted to say "thanks" to California Pizza Kitchen for their generous gifts of free meals to veterans on Veterans Day.  We went with friends to the one in Frisco and they were amazing.  They offered the two veterans at our table free meals of anything on the menu & free soft drinks.  When we ordered dessert (who can pass up their butter cake?!), they gave us that free also.  Our waiter thanked our guys several times, as did the manager, who stopped by our table & gave each of us gift cards for another free meal!  As we left, the rest of the employees thanked us!  How lovely for anyone who served  in the military to be honored so nicely!  THANKS CPK!

Good for a non-food court meal at the mall, but not for much else.

This was only my 2nd trip to CPK - and I am so glad we went.  We had an errand to run in Stonebriar Centre so we decided to wait for completion by having lunch here.  We were able to split a pizza - half with meats and the other with wild mushrooms, adding the $1.50 for white truffle oil.   As we waited for the pizza, we shared a Caesar salad and a bottle of vino.  The Caesar was fresh and once we added black pepper tasty enough.  It would have been better with freshly cracked black pepper but they don't offer that. When the pizza hit the table, the wait staff drizzled the oil on the mushroom side of the pizza.  Oh, how I love truffle oil!  I just discovered how delicious it is this year.  It is earthy, aromatic and adds just the lightest hint of dazzling flavor to the right types of food (pasta, steak or pizza).  There were more than a few times where I just closed my eyes, savoring each bite.  The earthiness of the mushrooms was heightened by the oil. I couldn't believe how wonderful the pizza was.  It was delicious and crunchy.  It was not laded down with sauce and you could hold it up.  The pizza crust stayed upright, no wiggling whatsoever.  Truly a cracker thin crust and I loved every bit of it.  So for those of you who don't like a lot of sauce, prefer a thin crust pizza with quality toppings this is the spot for you.  The menu is fairly extensive even if you are not in the mood for pizza - and I rarely rank a chain so high.  This meal was delicious!  What are you waiting for?  Go there, get some - life's too short for boring food!

I went here with my family of 5, three children and two adults. Right off the bat we where given a buzzer because all the tables where "full". However, I noticed that 4 + booths where empty. Upon returning to this restaurant, those tables where still empty and bustled. The hostess was very kind (I wish I would have seen her name) and she apologized about the 25 minute wait we endured. The manager talked to us and said to sit down at one of the booths I noticed in the beginning. We instantly received a waitress to order our drinks and food. The drinks took about 7 minutes to come to our table, but the FOOD. Oh my, that took 30 + minutes for a Five cheese pizza, a cheese pizza, a pepperoni pizza, a Hawaiian pizza, and a BBQ pizza. Granted, this was quite a lot of food. However the portions of these pizzas where small, therefore these should have taken about 15 minutes. Here is where the four stars come in, we learned that 3 workers had quit that day, and they where very understaffed. Even thought they where in short supply, the waitress (Jordan) was very helpful and came around every time my drink was almost empty. The pizza was great and I hope to come back again to enjoy a equally staffed environment.

Wow, I was blown away by customer service at the Stonebiar CPK.  I ordered take out from here and was less than pleased with the food experience, which has not happen often.  I decided to call the manager and let them know what had occurred, with the anticipation of writing them off and not returning.  She said what I had expected her to say which was "I'm sorry for the poor experience".  But then to my surprise, I received a letter in the mail with a heart felt hand written note which I was not expecting.  Customer Service is extremely important in gaining customer loyalty and keeping them coming back.  The store manager gained my respect and my loyalty as a customer and I will be returning to this restaurant because if you take the time to write a thoughtful hand written letter, then it goes without saying that you will take actions in your business to improve it.

Covered in baby slobber/handprints all over both Enter doors and the side windows. Super disgusting. Sat down, both ordered tea. "The opening person didn't brew tea" so we had to wait 20 minutes for them to actually brew the tea. Again, not mason's fault. He couldn't sub the $8.95 lunch pizza/soup combo for macaroni instead of soup, that happens. It's probably policy or register issues so I get that. The kid sized price was $5.79 and was the most chewy, bland macaroni I've ever had though. Not even worth $2. He came back to ask if everything was okay. My mistake was being too awkward to say I wanted a refund on the macaroni. I only took 2 bites, which was evident when he came up and when I left. Again, not his fault. This place was just so unprepared, unclean, and awful. The pizza was extremely extremely greasy. Much more than delivery chains even. This was my first, only, and last visit at a California pizza kitchen. What a disappointment. I completely understand now why the stars are low. I should have read Yelp reviews before wasting $20 on a pizza/soup combo, tea, and kids macaroni. Way way way overpriced for what you get. Save the calories and eat elsewhere.

I was extremely dissatisfied and disappointed by the service of the stonebrier mall CPK. I am a long time loyal CPK rewards member and have been eating at various locations in plano, Los Angeles, and Long Island for the past 10 years. I have always enjoyed my visits but this evening my party and I were seated for 15 minuets before even being contacted by my waitress. Finally when she arrived and took our orders she disappeared for another 28 minuets before she returned to tell me the meal I ordered was out of stalk this evening, I was obviously heart broken to hear this news and the fact that it was delivered so long after I ordered was even more horrific. There was no organization what so ever to the order our meals arrived, there was a 25 minute time lapse between the first and last meal to come out. To make everything worse... THE BREAD NEVER ARRIVED! The only sliver of hope during my entire meal was one individual who filled our waters after our waiter saw us without water 4 times and brought out parmesan. I'm honestly not even sure he even worked at this establishment but he was very dedicated to meeting our service needs and catering to our meal far better than any of the other servers that are probably employed at this establishment. I have honestly never had a worse dining experience. My party and I had plans to enjoy our evenings and we wanted to kick off our festivities with a delicious meal at our favorite restaurant but this awful experience crushed our spirits, not to mention it took nearly 2 hours and we only took 20 minutes to eat our food. I expected better CPK... I expected better.
